author: joedizzleify

text: If you restrict yourself to a platform, you get to design with its restrictions in mind.  Porting it to other systems then progressively upgrades your computing capacity, but your game design decisions stay the same.  It'd probably be as close to an old-school design experience as you're likely to get these days.
author: Fellshard

text: I am glad that it got released on the Wii U and 3DS.  This song is pretty good.  I really like side scrolling shooters.  Maybe i will purchase this game for the 3DS.
author: Eric C.

text: @Eric C. It got released for wii U and 3ds? I had no idea. I've got the dreamcast version which is really fun.
author: Spencer Jones

text: This great 2D side scrolling shooter was made in 2012 for the... Neo Geo. Then it was ported and released for the... Dreamcast. Yeah, in 2012. Pretty crazy! It later got released for the Wii U and 3DS so more people could actually play the game. It's extremely reminiscent to Factor 5's Turrican series, with a very solid soundtrack. I'll have to play this game someday, that's for sure.

text: I heard Volkor(Valkor? Volkar?) the Viking's developers were teasing about a Dreamcast port for their game. Nice music, as always!
